about.description: Stateful programmatic web browsing in Python, after Andy Lester's Perl module WWW::Mechanize.

name: mechanize
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "mechanize" %}
{% set version = "0.2.5" %}
{% set sha256 = "2e67b20d107b30c00ad814891a095048c35d9d8cb9541801cebe85684cc84766" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [py3k]
  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record=record.txt

requirements:
  build:
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python

test:
  imports:
    - mechanize

about:
  home: http://wwwsearch.sourceforge.net/mechanize/
  license: BSD 3-Clause or ZPL 2.1
  license_file: COPYING.txt
  summary: 'Stateful programmatic web browsing.'
  description: |
    Stateful programmatic web browsing in Python, after Andy Lester's Perl module WWW::Mechanize.
  dev_url: https://github.com/jjlee/mechanize

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - synapticarbors
